New Records: Karl-Anthony Towns finished with 27 points and 13 rebounds to pace the Knicks in blowing out the Toronto Raptors 112-98 on Wednesday night
Key Match Events: Karl-Anthony Towns punished the Raptors defense with 12 points and 11 rebounds in the second half, where the Knicks led by as many as 27
Josh Hart also hit 9-of-14 shots, overcoming pain from what appeared to be a hit to his rib in the first quarter
OG Anunoby also had an efficient night, making 8-of-13 shots, as he remained unbeaten in four games against his former team
Pre-Game Insights: Patrick Ewing, the best center in franchise history, watching from the baseline, Karl-Anthony Towns gave his best impression with a monster double-double to power the New York Knicks to a big win in his return from a two-game absence
Post-Match Reflections: New York coach Tom Thibodeau said. “As the game went along, we got stronger and stronger, and that's what we have to strive towards each day — get better, make corrections, improve — understand that it's a long season.
Thibodeau is unfazed and confident his team will meet the challenge.
“Look, we got a great group of guys that they work at it,” Thibodeau said. “Over the course of the season, sometimes you're going to stumble, and you got to get back up and you got to refocus.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Knicks improved to 25-13, the third-best record in the East.
The Raptors, though they are the second-worst team in the East, gave the Knicks a good warmup.
The 30-6 Thunder will be fired up after their 15-game winning streak was snapped by the Cleveland Cavaliers 129-122 in the battle of the NBA’s best teams on Wednesday night
Others: The Knicks will face the Oklahoma City Thunder, who gave them a 117-107 loss, which ignited their three-game skid.
Towns made it look easy, going 9-of-14 from the field for the Knicks, who improved to 25-13, the third-best record in the East.
